text: Autonomous vehicles (AVs) are poised to revolutionize transportation systems, with decision-making constituting a pivotal component of high-level automated driving. While rule-based methods have traditionally been employed, the emergence of data-driven decision-making approaches has garnered considerable attention, particularly for addressing complex scenarios. The quality and diversity of datasets utilized profoundly impact decision-making performance, necessitating a comprehensive understanding of available datasets. Driving data can be categorized into vehicle-, environment-, and driver-related data, each offering unique insights. This study undertakes a comparative analysis of state-of-the-art datasets across these categories, detailing their attributes such as sensor usage, annotation, and driving scenarios. Furthermore, potential applications of these datasets in various facets of AV decision-making are discussed, aiding researchers in selecting suitable datasets for their investigations. Finally, the future trajectory of AV dataset development is outlined, offering insights into forthcoming trends in this domain.
name: bla-031
